refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
The __any_grants()
can be used to test whether there are any rights granted (for insert/update/delete) to a table for current SQL account.

refsect2.title: tablename
refsect2.para: The table name to be tested.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: An integer will be returned to indicate whether the table supplied has any privileges granted (1) or not granted (zero 0) for current SQL user.

entry.errortext: Function any_grants needs a string as argument 1, not an arg of type [type]

example.title: Using the __any_grants() function
example.para: This simple example shows testing a grant rights for a table, using the __any_grants() function from ISQL and demo SQL user accout.
example.screen:
$isql localhost:1112 demo demo -- the demo account owns an Orders table, so it's granted SQL> select __any_grants ('Demo.demo.Orders'); callret INTEGER _______________________________________________________________________________
1
1 Rows. -- 1 msec.
-- but it has no permission to access the table SYS_REPL_ACCOUNTS SQL> select __any_grants ('DB.DBA.SYS_REPL_ACCOUNTS'); callret INTEGER _______________________________________________________________________________
0
1 Rows. -- 5 msec.
